sen.j: 天地の歌（あめつちのうた）は、手習い歌の一つで、すべての仮名を歌い込んだもの。
sen.e: Ametsuchi no Uta (literally, song of heaven and earth) is a pangram, which contains all the kana (the Japanese syllabary) characters as syllables of song.

sen.j: 上代特殊仮名遣のコの甲乙の区別は存在しないが、ア行のエとヤ行のエを区別している点から、平安初期（900年前後）の成立と見られる。
sen.e: Because two kinds of characters to express the pronunciation of "ko" found in the ancient special Kana usage are not distinguished while エ of the row of ア in the gojuonzu ("fifty-sound" syllabary chart) and エ of the row of ヤ are distinguished, Ametsuchi no Uta is thought to be established in the beginning of Heian period (around A.D.900.)

sen.j: 中国の千字文を意識して1行に名詞が4語並ぶように作られているが、5行目で早くも動詞を使用するなど形式的にも破綻しており、6行目は無意味な語の羅列になっているなど、作品としての出来は決してよいとは言えない。
sen.e: Following the structure of the Senjimon (a poem consisting of one thousand Chinese characters) of China, it was constructed so that four nouns consisted one line of poem, but it shows a collapse already in the fifth line as verbs were used and meaningless words were placed in the sixth line, resulting that this cannot be said as a good piece.

Following the structure of the Senjimon (a poem consisting of one thousand Chinese characters) in China, four nouns constitute one line of the poem at first, but it shows collapse already in the fifth line in terms of formality as verbs are used there and in addition meaningless words are placed in the sixth line; therefore it is hard to say this poem is a good piece.

sen.j: しかしながら、他に適当なものがなかったためか、いろは歌が普及する平安後期までは、もっぱら天地の歌が手習い歌として使用されていた。
sen.e: However, still Ametsuchi no Uta had been used mainly as a pangram until the end of Heian period probably because there had been no alternatives until The Iroha became popular.
